title: Liberté, Égalité, Equity: French Government Holds Key for Renault, Nissan
text:
The sudden management shakeup that started at Nissan earlier this week has spread to Renault. It is a pity it can’t also spread to the management that really matters for the car makers’ faltering alliance as well as Renault’s merger hopes with Fiat Chrysler: the French government.

On Tuesday, Nissan moved earlier than expected to name its new management team. Makoto Uchida, the head of the company’s all-important China business, will become chief executive. The choice of an internationally minded executive who hasn’t worked...
description: A management change at both car makers could pave the road to better relations, but can do little without the support of Emmanuel Macron.
